column1: angled down to third man
short of a length on the hip, tucked into square leg
appeal for lbw, might have pitched outside leg stump. Well outside leg and very high. Apart from that
touch of swing on this one, Edwards gets a little squared up as he plays into the covers
back of a length at middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
this one beats the outside edge, angled across outside off short of a length, Edwards playing away from his body
pushes a straight delivery down to long-on
an arm ball, shapes away from Edwards, mistimed into the leg side
that's the first sign of aggression, opens his stance a touch and lofts it well over long-off
worked off the pads to short fine leg, this would have been tight with a direct hit! Denly loses his bat as it digs into the turf next to the pitch
slices a drive in the air over backward point
tucks a straight ball into midwicket
cleans him up! Edwards' lean start to the BBL continues as he swings across the line of a full delivery and sees his off stump pegged back
back of a length outside off, 132kph, defended to backward point
slips this one down the leg side, excellent take diving across by Ludeman
full outside off, steered down to third man
full at off stump, 136kph, defended to cover
short of a length at leg stump, tries to tuck it away but can only get an inside edge into his pads
gets this one away over the off stump, drives on the up over backward point and third man comes around
beats the under edge with his first delivery as this keeps down a bit outside off, Hughes trying to play square...actually took the bottom edge, didn't reach the keeper
full outside off, driven to cover
nails this drive, came right out of the middle, but sends it straight to cover
slashes a length ball down to third man...comes off the toe end
nips back into the pads, an appeal for lbw but that's sliding down leg side
slower ball outside off, Denly is through his shot far too early and the ball bobbles to the leg side
over the wicket, short of a length outside off, square drives nicely but finds backward point
short of a length at off stump, pushed into the off side...seems quite hard to time
changes to round the wicket and it's costly, short of a length, Hughes latches on sweetly and pulls powerfully over midwicket
this is full outside off, driven to cover

chipped to midwicket! Debutant Harvey takes the catch. A full ball outside off, he tries to drive, the bat twists in his hands and the ball flies towards midwicket. Harvey made good ground to his right
good length outside off, nice stride into the ball and drives to cover
works a back-of-a-length ball into the leg side
through him! That's a beauty. Unplayable. Back of a length, zips back off the seam and beats the inside edge as he drives
a short-arm pull to a ball outside off, finds deep square
full outside off, a 117kph slower ball, nearly popped to backward point as he pushes at it

terrific catch running back as Christian judges this perfectly...Denly trying to go straight down the ground, not an easy pitch to drive on, goes very high in the air but doesn't have the distance. Christian watches it come over his shoulder and settles under it
another beauty that seams and bounces! Back of a length, nips back and climbs past the inside edge. Not easy out there
round the wicket, good length at off stump, defended
superb piece of fielding at backward point! A full-length dive to intercept a well-timed square drive
a straight delivery, worked off the pads to deep square leg
full and straight, he's a long way across the crease as this glances off the pad down the leg side...ah, well, no it doesn't, given wide. Not sure that's right!
delivered from very wide on the crease from round the wicket, full outside off, driven into the on side
good length, straight, 134kph and tucked into midwicket
good length at off stump, pushed to the off side as the hold on the Sixers batting continues
full at off stump, firmly driven to mid-off who is deep enough to allow the single
back of a length, opens the face and drops it towards backward point
at off stump, back of a length, pushed to the covers
brings out something adventurous as he moves across his crease and scoops a full delivery over the wicketkeeper...Richardson can't quite drag it back
full outside off, this is nicely driven wide of mid-off for a brace
a full toss angled into the pads, flicked towards fine leg and the man down there is quite square
goes back to quite a full delivery which slides on, pushes to the bowler
outside off, touch of slow turn, square driven to deep cover
full outside off, driven down the ground
drives out to the cover sweeper, thought of a second but decline it. Wisely
uses his feet then flicks a straight delivery towards deep square leg, they push hard for the second
full and straight, a punchy drive down to long-off
nips back off the seam, trapped into his pads and drops down by his feet. Has to be alert to get back to his crease
full outside off, a flick of the wrists sends this down to long-on
back of a length outside off, stays just leg side of the ball and drives firmly to deep cover
full and straight, punched back to the bowler
back of a length at off stump, angles the ball into backward point
driven out to deep cover but just singles in the over
comes down the pitch and drives along the ground to long-off
shorter outside off, comes very slowly off the surface, Henriques goes right across outside off and pulls to deep square
works a straight ball in front of square, the shot weighted perfectly for a second
shorter on off stump, bit of a top edge as he cuts but runs safely fine of short third man
down the track again, gets right to the pitch and drives to long-off
goes across his crease again, misses the sweep and it's very close to taking leg stump...scoots past the keeper and is called wides. Harsh
shorter outside off, very good placement as he rocks back and drives square through point. Slow outfield and good fielding keeps it to two
almost beats mid-off to his left with a strong drive but well hauled in
loses leg stump as he tries the scoop again, actually plays this off the face of the bat into the stumps...defeated by a slower ball, so credit to the bowler as well
full outside off, nicely into position and drives to cover
flicks a straight delivery off the pads to deep square, miscommunication from Shinwari and Harper allows a second
a wristy flick into the leg side
angled down to third man
gets a bottom edge into the pitch and it bounces close to the stumps
short outside off, driven to deep cover
full outside off, the bottom hand takes over and flicks out to deep midwicket
full and straight, flicked down the ground to long-on
full at leg stump, he's down the pitch and works out to deep midwicket
comes down outside leg stump, opens up the off side and drives very nicely just wide of long-off but good fielding means no chance of a second
back of a length, dragged over the leg side without much timing
slower ball, short outside off, carved very powerfully over the off side but straight at the sweeper
dabbed backward of point
driven into the off side without much timing
goes in the air and gets it just wide of mid-off, another attempt to drive on the up
angled into the pads, shovelled to deep square leg
full outside off, driven with lots of power but the ball just rolls towards long-off
that's quite a sharp bouncer, he goes for the pull and gets the wide call
back on a good length at off stump, pushed firmly into midwicket
swing and a miss across the line of a slower ball
fantastic shot! That's what gets people talking about Philippe as he gets on the front foot and plays a sweep/pull over deep square leg
over the leg side again! Takes on the full delivery this time, so much power through the ball, clubbed wide of long-on
full, wider outside off, moves across the crease and drives into the covers
finds long-on, so just as he was getting going he's gone...down the pitch, Nabi holds it back a bit, can't get the distance as he tries to go down the ground
stays leg side of a full delivery and drives down to long-off, had a to wait a long time for that to get to him
pushes forward into the off side
moving to the leg side again, this is a touch shorter, square drives to deep point
goes back in the crease and drives to the covers
follows the batsman this time and it's worked off the pads into the leg side
down the pitch, not to the ball, clubbed straight down the ground
short outside off, powerful cracked through the covers off the back foot, Harvey makes good ground around the boundary
touch short again, waits for the turn and square drives to the other side of Harvey this time. Another brace
into the pads, flicked to midwicket
flat-batted drive into the covers
short outside off, sent out to deep cover
poor start, short outside off and Curran has nailed that square of the wicket. A very powerful square cut
full and straight, strongly clipped down to long-on
short of a length outside off, a slower ball, dragged through midwicket
full outside off, angled towards backward point
well bowled, done completely by the slower ball! Short of a length, Silk is through his shot and it loops off the toe end back to the bowler
short at off stump, cramped a little for room as he pulls to midwicket
round the wicket, back of a length, takes the outside edge back towards the keep as he tries to heave through the leg side
back of a length, straight, pulled to deep square
has a mighty swing across the line and doesn't connect...a cutter, and it bounce over off stump
full and straight, and what power in that! A bottom-handed jab down the ground that splits the fielders perfectly
and this time he swivels on a pull to long leg
swings across the line against the change of pace and it's through to the keeper
full outside off, carves a drive square of the wicket towards backward point...brings out a full-length dive to make his ground
back of a length outside off, swung into the off side
short of a length outside off, clubbed in the air, goes one bounce to long-off...another slower ball means no pace to work with
full at off stump, 136kph this time, drills his drive straight to cover
that's useful! Drops this shorter, a big swing across the line and it clears deep square leg. Actually came off the toe end
another safe catch from Christian to end the innings, Abbott trying to launch this down the ground but can't clear long-off
good start, beats the outside with a length ball. Hint of movement
tight to off stump, defended to the covers
beaten again by some late swing, back of a length outside off, Harvey just feeling for it a little
fuller outside off, gets forward and plays a confident square drive behind point. Excellent placement wide of third man
full at off stump, 138kph, a powerful drive but straight to cover
drags this down short on off stump, a crunching front-foot pull shot, power in the forearms, sends it in front of square
full and straight, takes an inside edge into the front pad as he comes forward
angled into the pads, he misses his flick and gets a leg bye towards square leg
that's a beauty! Back of a length, pitches around middle and seams past the outside edge. Would be in good form to nick that
short of a length at off stump, played square to the off side
on the pads, flicked firmly to deep square leg
pushed down the leg side
full outside off, that's a punchy cover drive and again the slow outfield means there isn't value for the shot
a fingertips chance at backward point as he crunches a square drive, would have been some catch by Silk but he's known for blinders
full and straight, punched to mid-on
leading edge loops over mid-off, looking to turn a full delivery through the leg side
full outside off, a half volley, driven through the cover field and it just has the legs to dribble into the rope.
short of a length on leg stump, takes the pad behind square
full at leg stump, clipped very sweetly through midwicket. That's a lovely piece of timing on a tricky surface
back of a length, worked towards mid-on
full outside off, not too far from dragging this on as it takes the inside as he drives
clips a full delivery behind square on the leg side
back of a length outside off, 134kph, played towards point
short of a length, straight, whipped off the hip to deep square
back of a length, on the stumps, can't beat backward point
bottom edge into the stumps swinging across the line at a back-of-a-length delivery, just what Henriques and Curran had spoken about before the over
short of a length, pushed down the leg side
good length at off stump, punched firmly to mid-off
nips back off the seam, White takes his bottom hand off the bat as he works it around the corner to short fine leg
full and straight, squirts off a thick outside edge towards point
pushed off the pads into midwicket
round the wicket, wide outside off, a slashing square drive and it bursts through Silk's hand at backward point
short of a length, another short-arm pull through midwicket
drives a length delivery into the covers
swings at a full delivery, loses his shape a bit and it scoots to deep square leg
swing and a miss at a good-length ball, almost uses his off stump

caught at mid-off as this one nearly hits the roof...White got underneath this lofted drive, went straight up into the air, hitting the roof would have been six, but it settles in the hands as it comes down
tight to middle and off, pushed to the covers
round the wicket, driven in the air over point
round the wicket, on off stump, pushed back down the pitch
played square into the off side
square driven to deep point
driven down to long-off
full outside leg stump, brings out the slog sweep and the placement is excellent over deep backward square
flicked into midwicket
full and straight, drilled down the ground
back to the bowler
pushed down the ground to long-on
takes off stump, wicket in his first over! Lovely delivery, just straightened enough to beat the edge as Harvey gave himself a touch of room to drive through the off side
width outside off from round the wicket, cut to deep point
round the wicket, back of a length outside off, finds poimnt
full outside off, driven to mid-off
played wide of point and third man can't stop the second
full outside off, driven to cover
gets forward and drives to backward point
back of a length outside off, driven powerfully square of the wicket and Edwards has to be swift on the cover boundary
played down the ground to long-off
full and straight, flicked to deep square
length ball at the stumps, driven back to the bowler
full at leg stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
moves early outside leg then drives down to long-off
low full toss, strongly driven straight and Manenti does well to get a hand on it in his follow through
worked into the leg side
full at off stump, pushed back to the bowler
width outside off, driven square of the wicket and more work in the deep for Edwards
driven inside out over cover, wide of long-off
this comes on with the arm outside off, takes a bottom edge as he tries to cut
back of a length, punched down the ground. Tight over
down to long-off and now the Sixers are back in it! Manenti having a terrific debut. Cooper trying to go straight down the ground, slices it a little and a comfortable catch
worked off the pads into midwicket
full and straight, driven firmly to cover
digs out a yorker down to long-on
gets forward and pushes into the leg side
length ball, played into the off side...another very good over from the debutant
and another catch to long-off! The Renegades in trouble now...Nabi moved outside leg to open up the off side, tried to loft this but couldn't get it over or wide of Denly. Nicely held back by O'Keefe
uses his feet, flicks it firmly back to the bowler who can't quite cut it off

beautiful delivery, caught behind! That's a genuine left-arm spinner's wicket. Round the wicket, angled in at off stump, grips and spins significantly to take the edge and it's a good take behind the stumps
full outside off, driven down the ground
played square of the wicket to point
comes down the pitch, nearly beaten by the turn but is just able to adjust
very full, dug out to midwicket
shorter, down the leg side as Wildermuth moves across the crease
this is outside off, goes on straight, pushed to the covers
worked off the pads to short fine leg
full and pushed back to the bowler
full at off stump, driven to deep cover...keeps getting it right up there
misses his flick off the pads and it dribbles to the leg side
back of a length at off stump, angled through the covers
short outside off, he goes for the pull and doesn't make contact
full and straight, played back to Abbott
short of a length, straight, tucked to deep midwicket
edged, caught behind, that could be the game! Full at off stump, just a hint of movement, he goes for the drive and it's an edge behind
full outside off, steered down to third man and they are able to make the second
full on the pads, flicked out to deep midwicket
cuts this away from off stump to point
same ball, same shot and this time he scampers a single to point
plays back in the crease and works a shorter delivery to the leg side
slides on towards the stumps, cut to backward point
almost gets through with the arm ball, takes the bottom edge as he cuts
slower ball outside off, back of the hand, goes for a slog sweep and he's way too early on the shot
dropped, almost a terrific rebound effort from Curran! A full ball, jabbed back to him, stuck up his left hand and almost caught it coming back down. But it's a dot ball
slips into the pads, clipped to deep midwicket...they need way more than singles

that's big! Moved across his crease and picked up a delivery that was pretty wide outside off, Curran and seen him move, but Boyce manages to swing it over deep midwicket. Was a back-of-the-hand slower ball
full and straight, Boyce goes deep in his crease and creams this to long-on
finds long-on! And the Sixers close in further. He struck this pretty sweetly. Curran didn't quite get the yorker in, Wildermuth middled it over the leg side but didn't quite get the placement
back of a length outside off, crunched to deep midwicket
gets the yorker in, jabbed back to the bowler
clipped off the toes through the leg side, splits deep midwicket and deep square leg
leg stump yorker, clipped to short fine leg. Would have been close with a direct hit
plays around a very full delivery outside off, probably beat him as a full toss
moves across the crease and connects well with a scoop/flick, but goes straight to short fine leg
over the wicket, lofted straight down the ground
short of a length, completely mistimes a cross-batted swipe and it lobs over the bowler
big swing at a length ball angled across him, flies down to third man
full and straight, drilled down the ground
almost loses his off stump as a yorker goes between his legs as he tries to flick to the leg side
full, wide outside off, jabbed to backward point
low full toss which is clubbed to deep midwicket, good catch by the very safe Silk
close! A slower ball yorker which slips between the batsman's legs and leg stump
digs out a yorker to the off side
slower ball, driven to deep cover
driven into the off side
clubs a full delivery down to long-on
